I recently took the plunge and bought myself a DJI Phantom 3. It's a fantastic piece of tech. Very easy to fly and takes great photos and video. Has anyone else here been bitten by the bug?

Here are a few of the shots I have taken so far with it.

![ULEDqTF.png](http://i.imgur.com/ULEDqTF.png)

and the obligatory 'Dronie' 

![ldFjfMX.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ldFjfMX.jpg)

I got an AR.Drone a few years ago, the one with 2 cameras. I played with it quite a bit for the first couple months. Haven't touched it since ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Hows the battery runtime?

Most of my flights are 15-18 minutes, but I make a point of landing with at least 20% battery left (the App squawks at you when you hit 30% by default). DJI claims 23 minutes of battery and I believe that, assuming you are willing to run it down below 10%.
+1 rep for the 'Dronie' ... first time I've ever heard that one. lol

> 
> and the obligatory 'Dronie'

New term coined.

I'm working on a drone that's flying itself atm, but can't make it to fly straight for more than 5 m. Its erratic flying is funny, but a failure nonetheless. Hope it gets better ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I can't claim the term "Dronie" as it has been around for awhile now....

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dronie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dronie)
